api_key.description: The API key for authentication. May also be provided via the ARCHESTRA_API_KEY environment variable.

base_url.description: The base URL for the Archestra API. May also be provided via the ARCHESTRA_BASE_URL environment variable.

block.description: The Archestra provider is used to interact with Archestra resources. The provider needs to be configured with the proper credentials before it can be used.

id.description: Chat LLM Provider API key identifier

is_organization_default.description: Whether this API key is the organization default for the provider

llm_provider.description: LLM provider for this API key

block.description: Manages Chat LLM Provider API keys in Archestra.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the config was created

enabled.description: Whether the dual LLM config is enabled

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the config was last updated

block.description: Manages a Dual LLM Security Config in Archestra.

entity_id.description: The entity ID this limit applies to

entity_type.description: Entity type: organization, team, or profile

limit_type.description: Limit type: 'token_cost' (requires model), 'tool_calls' (requires mcp_server_name and tool_name), or 'mcp_server_calls' (requires mcp_server_name)

mcp_server_name.description: Required when limit_type is 'mcp_server_calls' or 'tool_calls'. Name of the MCP server.

model.description: Required when limit_type is 'token_cost'. List of model names this limit applies to.

tool_name.description: Required when limit_type is 'tool_calls'. Name of the tool this limit applies to.

block.description: Manages usage limits in Archestra.

auth_fields.description: Custom authentication fields required by the MCP server

docs_url.description: URL to the MCP server documentation

installation_command.description: Installation command for the MCP server (e.g., npm install -g @example/mcp-server)

arguments.description: Arguments to pass to the command

command.description: The executable command to run (e.g., 'node', 'python', 'npx'). Optional if Docker Image is set (will use image's default CMD).

docker_image.description: Custom Docker image URL. If not specified, Archestra's default base image will be used.

environment.description: Environment variables for the MCP server (KEY=value format)

local_config.description: Configuration for MCP servers run in the Archestra orchestrator MCP runtime

name.description: The name of the MCP server

client_id.description: OAuth Client ID. Leave empty if the server supports dynamic client registration.

scopes.description: List of OAuth scopes to request (e.g., ['read', 'write'])

supports_resource_metadata.description: Enable if the server publishes OAuth metadata at /.well-known/oauth-authorization-server for automatic endpoint discovery

oauth_config.description: OAuth configuration for the remote MCP server. If not specified, users can authenticate with a Personal Access Token (PAT) via auth_fields.

url.description: The URL of the remote MCP server (e.g., https://api.githubcopilot.com/mcp/)

remote_config.description: Configuration for remote/hosted MCP servers accessed via HTTP

block.description: Manages an MCP server in the Private MCP Registry. This allows you to register local MCP servers that can then be installed by profiles.

display_name.description: The actual name of the MCP server installation as returned by the API. The API may append a suffix to ensure uniqueness.

mcp_server_id.description: The MCP server ID from the private MCP registry (archestra_mcp_registry_catalog_item resource)

name.description: The name of the MCP server installation.

block.description: Manages an Archestra MCP server installation.

entity_id.description: Entity ID this rule applies to

entity_type.description: Entity type: organization, team, or profile

llm_provider.description: LLM provider: openai, anthropic, or gemini

block.description: Manages cost optimization rules in Archestra.

color_theme.description: Color theme for the organization UI

convert_tool_results_to_toon.description: Whether to convert tool results to TOON format for compression

font.description: Custom font for the organization UI

limit_cleanup_interval.description: Interval for cleaning up usage limits. Valid values: 1h, 12h, 24h, 1w, 1m. Set to null to disable.

logo.description: Base64 encoded logo image for the organization

block.description: Manages organization settings in Archestra. This is a singleton resource - only one instance can exist per organization. Note: Running `terraform destroy` will only remove this resource from Terraform state; the organization settings will remain unchanged on the server.

labels.description: Labels to organize and identify the profile

block.description: Manages an Archestra profile.

allow_usage_when_untrusted_data_is_prese.description: Whether to allow tool usage when untrusted data is present

credential_source_mcp_server_id.description: The ID of the MCP Server instance to use for credentials/authentication

execution_source_mcp_server_id.description: The ID of the MCP Server instance to use for execution

id.description: The unique identifier of the profile-tool assignment (Composite ID: profile_id:tool_id)

profile_id.description: The ID of the Profile to assign the tool to

response_modifier_template.description: Template string to modify the tool response before it reaches the model

tool_id.description: The ID of the Tool to assign

tool_result_treatment.description: How to treat tool results (trusted, sanitize_with_dual_llm, untrusted)

use_dynamic_team_credential.description: If true, dynamically resolves credentials based on the team context at runtime

block.description: Assigns a tool to an Archestra Profile and configures its execution and security policies.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the prompt was created

parent_prompt_id.description: The identifier of the parent prompt if this is a version

profile_id.description: The profile identifier this prompt belongs to

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the prompt was last updated

block.description: Manages a prompt in the Archestra private prompt registry.

domain.description: Organization domain associated with this provider.

domain_verified.description: Whether the domain has been verified.

issuer.description: Issuer for this provider (OIDC issuer URL or SAML entity ID).

provider_id.description: Unique provider identifier (e.g. Okta, Google, Keycloak).

override_user_info.description: Use token claims instead of userinfo when true.

token_endpoint_authentication.description: Token endpoint auth method (client_secret_basic or client_secret_post).

block.description: Attribute mapping for user fields.
OIDC configuration (cannot be set with saml_config).
Optional role mapping rules using Handlebars expressions.
IdP metadata details.
Attribute mapping for user fields.
SP metadata details.
SAML configuration (cannot be set with oidc_config).
Optional team sync configuration for group extraction.
Manages Archestra SSO providers (OIDC or SAML). Exactly one of oidc_config or saml_config must be set.

created_by.description: User ID of the team creator

role.description: Role of the team member (default: member)

user_id.description: User ID of the team member

organization_id.description: The organization ID this team belongs to

block.description: Manages an Archestra team with members.

external_group_id.description: External IdP group identifier (LDAP DN, OIDC group name, SAML attribute, etc).

block.description: Manages external identity provider group sync for a team.

llm_provider.description: LLM provider: openai, anthropic, or gemini

block.description: Manages token pricing for LLM models in Archestra.

action.description: The action to take when the policy matches. Valid values: `allow_when_context_is_untrusted`, `block_always`

profile_tool_id.description: The profile tool ID this policy applies to

block.description: Manages an Archestra tool invocation policy.

action.description: The action to take when the policy matches. Valid values: `mark_as_trusted`, `block_always`, `sanitize_with_dual_llm` (default: `mark_as_trusted`)

profile_tool_id.description: The profile tool ID this policy applies to

block.description: Manages an Archestra trusted data policy.
Fetches a tool from an MCP server by MCP server ID and tool name. This data source is useful for looking up tools provided by MCP servers.

allow_usage_when_untrusted_data_is_prese.description: Whether to allow tool usage when untrusted data is present

id.description: Profile tool identifier (use this for policy profile_tool_id)

block.description: Fetches a profile tool by profile ID and tool name. This data source is useful for looking up the profile_tool_id needed to create trusted data policies and tool invocation policies.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the prompt was created

parent_prompt_id.description: The identifier of the parent prompt if this is a version

profile_id.description: The profile identifier this prompt belongs to

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the prompt was last updated

block.description: Provides information about a specific Archestra prompt.

prompt_id.description: The identifier of the prompt to list versions for

name.description: The name of the prompt at this version

system_prompt.description: The system prompt at this version

updated_at.description: Timestamp when this version was created/updated

user_prompt.description: The user prompt at this version

block.description: Provides a list of versions for a specific Archestra prompt.

created_by.description: User ID of the team creator

user_id.description: User ID of the team member

organization_id.description: The organization ID this team belongs to

block.description: Fetches an Archestra team by ID.

groups.description: The list of external groups associated with the team.

team_id.description: The ID of the team whose external groups will be listed.

block.description: Lists all external groups synced to an Archestra team.
Fetches all token prices from Archestra.

base_rfc3339.description: Base timestamp in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (see [RFC3339 time string](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`). Defaults to the current time.

id.description: RFC3339 format of the offset timestamp, e.g. `2020-02-12T06:36:13Z`.

offset_days.description: Number of days to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offset_hours.description: Number of hours to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offset_minutes.description: Number of minutes to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offset_months.description: Number of months to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offset_seconds.description: Number of seconds to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offset_years.description: Number of years to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

rfc3339.description: RFC3339 format of the offset timestamp, e.g. `2020-02-12T06:36:13Z`.

triggers.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger a new base timestamp value to be saved. See [the main provider documentation](../index.md) for more information.

unix.description: Number of seconds since epoch time, e.g. `1581489373`.

block.description: Manages an offset time resource, which keeps an UTC timestamp stored in the Terraform state that is offset from a locally sourced base timestamp. This prevents perpetual differences caused by using the [`timestamp()` function](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/functions/timestamp.html).

id.description: RFC3339 format of the timestamp, e.g. `2020-02-12T06:36:13Z`.

rfc3339.description: Base timestamp in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (see [RFC3339 time string](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`). Defaults to the current time.

rotation_days.description: Number of days to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotation_hours.description: Number of hours to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotation_minutes.description: Number of minutes to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotation_months.description: Number of months to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotation_rfc3339.description: Configure the rotation timestamp with an [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format of the offset timestamp. When the current time has passed the rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotation_years.description: Number of years to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

triggers.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger a new base timestamp value to be saved. These conditions recreate the resource in addition to other rotation arguments. See [the main provider documentation](../index.md) for more information.

unix.description: Number of seconds since epoch time, e.g. `1581489373`.

block.description: Manages a rotating time resource, which keeps a rotating UTC timestamp stored in the Terraform state and proposes resource recreation when the locally sourced current time is beyond the rotation time. This rotation only occurs when Terraform is executed, meaning there will be drift between the rotation timestamp and actual rotation. The new rotation timestamp offset includes this drift. This prevents perpetual differences caused by using the [`timestamp()` function](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/functions/timestamp.html) by only forcing a new value on the set cadence.

create_duration.description: [Time duration](https://golang.org/pkg/time/#ParseDuration) to delay resource creation. For example, `30s` for 30 seconds or `5m` for 5 minutes. Updating this value by itself will not trigger a delay.

destroy_duration.description: [Time duration](https://golang.org/pkg/time/#ParseDuration) to delay resource destroy. For example, `30s` for 30 seconds or `5m` for 5 minutes. Updating this value by itself will not trigger a delay. This value or any updates to it must be successfully applied into the Terraform state before destroying this resource to take effect.

id.description: RFC3339 format of the offset timestamp, e.g. `2020-02-12T06:36:13Z`.

triggers.description: (Optional) Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will run any creation or destroy delays again. See [the main provider documentation](../index.md) for more information.

block.description: Manages a resource that delays creation and/or destruction, typically for further resources. This prevents cross-platform compatibility and destroy-time issues with using the [`local-exec` provisioner](https://www.terraform.io/docs/provisioners/local-exec.html).

id.description: RFC3339 format of the offset timestamp, e.g. `2020-02-12T06:36:13Z`.

rfc3339.description: Base timestamp in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (see [RFC3339 time string](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`). Defaults to the current time.

triggers.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger a new base timestamp value to be saved. See [the main provider documentation](../index.md) for more information.

unix.description: Number of seconds since epoch time, e.g. `1581489373`.

block.description: Manages a static time resource, which keeps a locally sourced UTC timestamp stored in the Terraform state. This prevents perpetual differences caused by using the [`timestamp()` function](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/functions/timestamp.html).

duration_parse.description: Given a [Go duration string](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration), will parse and return an object representation of that duration.
duration_parse.summary: Parse a [Go duration string](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) into an object

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Go time package duration string to parse

rfc3339_parse.description: Given an RFC3339 timestamp string, will parse and return an object representation of that date and time.
rfc3339_parse.summary: Parse an RFC3339 timestamp string into an object

unix_timestamp_parse.description: Given a unix timestamp integer, will parse and return an object representation of that date and time. A unix timestamp is the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 UTC.
unix_timestamp_parse.summary: Parse a unix timestamp integer into an object
